issue.title: Mac app crashes if AppSupport external drive dismounts during initial blockchain sync
issue.body:
### Can you reliably reproduce the issue?
Has reproduced 4/4 times so far

#### If so, please list the steps to reproduce below:
0. Been doing initial blockchain sync for the last couple days, not done yet 
1. I have my ~/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin symlinked to an external drive due to SSD size
2. Flakey USB C <-> USB coupler cable that disconnects if moved a certain way
3. During blockchain download, if disconnected, the app crashes

### Expected behaviour
Display an error, or just quit silently, would be nice to have.

IIRC it asked me where to save data at the start, but not realizing how big the blockchain was, I ran out of disk space, and did a poor man's copy of data to external and symlinked the default dir. I'm assuming the symlink and flakey cable aren't relevant.

### Actual behaviour
App window disappears, get a crash dialog (seemingly always takes a minute, not sure if that's an OS bug)

### What version of bitcoin-core are you using?
The app version is 0.15.0, prebuild from bitcoin.org

### Machine specs:
- OS: 10.13
- CPU: Intel Core i7 2.5 ghz (MacBook Pro 2017 13")
- RAM: 16 gb
- Disk size: 256 gb w/ 3 tb external
- Disk Type (HD/SDD): ssd w/ hdd

### Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process.

events.body: Bitcoin Core can't handle its datadir dissapearing out from under it well, and there isn't much to be done about that (without implementing some full freeze-the-whole-app-until-its-back logic). It would be nice if we didn't wholesale crash, but you should consider running with -prune on your internal disk instead.

Agree with @TheBlueMatt
The heavy I/O levelDB database (UTXO set) as well as the block files can't handle a sudden "disappear" of its file/folder structures.
A fix for that is probably out of scope. Closing.
